intro: Brachylaena hutchinsii, commonly known as the red-hot-plate, is a shrub native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, bright red bracts that form a dense, flame-like display during the flowering season. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is known for its succulent leaves and stems. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The red-hot-plate is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun exposure.
